Question: The Royal Society proclaimed in a study that it was this person who was the true discoverer and labelled Leibniz a fraud.
Hints: This person did have a close friendship with the Swiss mathematician Nicolas Fatio de Duillier, whom he met in London around 1690.
This person had been reluctant to publish his calculus because he feared controversy and criticism.
This tract contained the nucleus that this person developed and expanded to form the Principia.
